Sentencas: Durability of a nickel and scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode against toluene in hydrogen was evaluated in this paper.
Titulo: A tolerance criterion for tar concentration in a model wood gas for a nickel/scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Anode deterioration was judged by the loss of elemental nickel from a surface of an anode.
Titulo: A tolerance criterion for tar concentration in a model wood gas for a nickel/scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Elemental nickel loss was observed when the toluene concentration was 3 or 10 g/Nm(3), steam to carbon ratio was 1, and current density was 0.5 A/cm(2) at both temperatures: 1073 K and 1173 K.
Titulo: A tolerance criterion for tar concentration in a model wood gas for a nickel/scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Therefore the tolerance criterion must be less than 3 g/Nm(3) in hydrogen in the experimental conditions.
Titulo: A tolerance criterion for tar concentration in a model wood gas for a nickel/scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: However, the deterioration can be mitigated to some extent by increasing the operating temperature, steam-to-carbon ratio, or current density.
Titulo: A tolerance criterion for tar concentration in a model wood gas for a nickel/scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Anode deterioration was also mitigated when hydrogen concentration in the fuel gas was nearly identical to that of wood gas.
Titulo: A tolerance criterion for tar concentration in a model wood gas for a nickel/scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The influence of hydrogen concentration in the fuel gas on deterioration may be substantial.
Titulo: A tolerance criterion for tar concentration in a model wood gas for a nickel/scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The loss of elemental nickel could not be detected instantaneously by electrochemical diagnosis.
Titulo: A tolerance criterion for tar concentration in a model wood gas for a nickel/scandia-stabilized zirconia cermet anode in a solid oxide fuel cell
